title: Cyril Connell Sr.
text:
Cyril John Connell <a href="CBE">CBE</a> (6 June 1899 – 25 October 1974) was an Australian university registrar and <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer and administrator. His son <a href="Cyril%20Connell%20Jr.">Cyril Connell Jr.</a> also went on to become a successful rugby league footballer in his era.
Connell was born in <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>, <a href="New%20South%20Wales">New South Wales</a> and in his youth he fought in <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a>, serving with the <a href="First%20Australian%20Imperial%20Force">Australian Imperial Force</a> in France. In 1922 he was of the first <a href="Queensland%20Maroons">Queensland team</a> to defeat New South Wales.
After retiring from the football field Connell also served as an administrator for the <a href="Queensland%20Rugby%20League">Queensland Rugby League</a>.
Connell's time as registrar of the <a href="University%20of%20Queensland">University of Queensland</a> is thought to have contributed significantly to the University's growth in the 1950s and 1960s. This earned him the honour of Commander (civil) of the <a href="Order%20of%20the%20British%20Empire">Order of the British Empire</a> in 1965.
In 2000 Connell was awarded the <a href="Australian%20Sports%20Medal">Australian Sports Medal</a> for his contribution to Australia's international standing in rugby league.
